abstract: There are certain subtle agencies at work in all forms of matter which are far more perplexing to the engineer than the bolder and apparently more formidable opposition of gravity and the intractability of materials. Expansion by heat and contraction by cold is an ever prevalent example. With each going down of the sun buildings, bridges, railways and machinery change their form; at every breaking of the clouds they warp and dilate with each new degree of temperature. But in case of mechanism, where not only extreme accuracy is essential, but where the expansion due to a high artificial heat must be provided against or compensated for, the whole design of an otherwise perfected apparatus may require modification and new adaptation. This illustrates the character of these unostentatious, but never tiring agencies which dispute each inch of ground with man, in the irrepressible conflict of mind with matter.
lead_paragraph: There are certain subtle agencies at work in all forms of matter which are far more perplexing to the engineer than the bolder and apparently more formidable opposition of gravity and the intractability of materials. This illustrates the character of these unostentatious, but never tiring agencies which dispute each inch of ground with man, in the irrepressible conflict of mind with matter.

abstract: The examination of the Chinaman, "Jackaloo," charged with the murder of Jonathan and Josiah Leete, on board the sloop Spray, of Guilford, Conn., was resumed yesterday morning before United States Commissioner J.P. VROOM and Recorder BEDFORD, at Jersey City. The excitement was as great as ever, and the Court-room was filled during the greater part of the day.
lead_paragraph: The examination of the Chinaman, "Jackaloo," charged with the murder of Jonathan and Josiah Leete, on board the sloop Spray, of Guilford, Conn., was resumed yesterday morning before United States Commissioner J.P. VROOM and Recorder BEDFORD, at Jersey City. The excitement was as great as ever, and the Court-room was filled during the greater part of the day. The prisoner evinced the same stolidity which has distinguished him since his arrest, except that once or twice he lost his composure, and attempted to explain matters to the Court. Mr. Jelliffe, the prosecuting officer, caused the sloop to be towed to the dry-dock at North Point, in order that a thorough search might be made in her cabin. The propriety of this course has been made apparent by the discovery of more proofs that blood has been shed on board of her. Still further developments are expected when, the vessel shall have been hauled out of the water.
headline: {'main': 'LAW REPORTS.; THE MURDERS ON THE SLOOP SPRAY. abstract: In the House of Commons on the 16th, on the order for going in a Committee of Supply, Sir DE LACY EVANS, who had given notice of a series of resolutions on the subject of the expedition against China, drew attention to the vast armament which was to form that expedition, and which must cost, he said, an enormous sum of money, with little chance of its being repaid by the Imperial Government at Peking.
lead_paragraph: In the House of Commons on the 16th, on the order for going in a Committee of Supply, Sir DE LACY EVANS, who had given notice of a series of resolutions on the subject of the expedition against China, drew attention to the vast armament which was to form that expedition, and which must cost, he said, an enormous sum of money, with little chance of its being repaid by the Imperial Government at Peking. He thought it would not be desirable that the troops should march upon that capital, and he hoped that Lord J. RUSSELL would be able to inform the House that strict instructions would be given for the conduct of the expedition. He forebore to move the resolutions of which he had given notice, and substituted a resolution founded upon the wish expressed in Her Majesty's speech on the opening of the present session: "It will be gratifying to me if the prompt acquiescence of the Emperor of China in the moderate demands which will be made by the Plenipotentiaries shall obviate the necessity for the employment of force."

abstract: At the theatres we have had but one novelty during the week -- Mr. DION BOURCICAULT's drama of "Colleen Bawn; or, The Brides of Garryowen," which was produced on Thursday evening, at Miss LAURA KEENE's theatre. It obtained a success of the first class, and will, in all probability, keep the stage until the close of the season. The applause was vehement, and of that quick responsive kind which speaks so distinctly of sustained interest and animation. All the artists were called out and Mr. BOURCICAULT, at the end, made mate little speech, with just a touch of the blarney in it to prove that the performance was as satisfactory with the author as with the public. He said -- very truly, too -- that the field of Irish history and romance, whilst singularly rich in dramatic material, is almost un-trodden by the modern dramatist. A certain class of piece, remarkable for its stupidity, passes muster, to be sure, as the Irish drama, and exhibits rather too liberally the virtues of an agrarian peasantry, the depravity of cultivated classes, and the supreme reformations that are effected on the latter by the free use of the shillelah. But, like negro minstrelsy, this fashion of fun has gone out of date. Mr. BOURCICAULT, in exploring the romances of GERALD GRIFFIN, has opened new ground, and so successfully that a rich harvest may fairly be anticipated from his initial effort.

A certain class of piece, remarkable for its stupidity, passes muster, to be sure, as the Irish drama, and exhibits rather too liberally the virtues of an agrarian peasantry, the depravity of cultivated classes, and the supreme reformations that are effected on the latter by the free use of the shillelah. But, like negro minstrelsy, this fashion of fun has gone out of date. Mr. BOURCICAULT, in exploring the romances of GERALD GRIFFIN, has opened new ground, and so successfully that a rich harvest may fairly be anticipated from his initial effort.

abstract: Telegraphic communication between Alexandria and Ku[???]achee was complete, and a private dispatch had reached England from Calcutta in the space of six days! Had the cable between Alexandria and Gibraltar been complete the news would not have been more than a day or two in reaching its destination. The dispatch in question announces that the British ship Red Gauntlet was partially burnt at Calcutta on the 10th of March, but that her cargo would be saved.

abstract: The total result of the voting in Tuscany on the question of annexation to Piedmont, was as follows: Total number inscribed, 386,446; for annexation, 366,571; for a separate kingdom, 14,925; canceled 4,949.
